article_text:
Good morning,

The Clawback Club

Tens of thousands of Wall Street bankers face tighter restrictions on how they are paid under new rules proposed by U.S. regulators in response to the financial crisis. The rules to curb risk-taking go beyond senior executives to deal makers and traders who receive large shares of their pay in the form of bonuses. Many on Wall Street say the proposal threatens to exacerbate a flight of talent from the banking sector to other fields such as hedge-fund firms and technology companies. The...

article_summary:
Many on Wall Street say the proposal threatens to exacerbate a flight of talent from the banking sector to other fields such as hedge-fund firms and technology companies.
Good morning,The Clawback ClubTens of thousands of Wall Street bankers face tighter restrictions on how they are paid under new rules proposed by U.S. regulators in response to the financial crisis.
The rules to curb risk-taking go beyond senior executives to deal makers and traders who receive large shares of their pay in the form of bonuses.
